text:
hi Mitchum, can you be more explicit about, what changes are breaking your styles?
To roll out new feature or to fix bugs we have to change things but we usually try to keep backward compatibility. If we haven't done that we'll surely want to fix it.
To answer your question there's no supported way to force it to a certain version as it'll mean those forms are stuck from getting updates and we can't ensure changes in our backend won't break them.
Thanks guys! This looks very in-depth! Gonna plow through it this weekend
A file, which can't be shown because your team is past the free storage limit, was commented on.
A file, which can't be shown because your team is past the free storage limit, was commented on.
<@U25PYL3Q8> I get it - did you try putting in a variable there instead of the requested URL ? that’d have been my first test lol
Or try putting another custom hubl variable in the social share url builder fields
so something like {{custom_social_url}} and set that variable somewhere in the code before the module?

Hi guys, is it possible to add css styling for the HubSpot chatbot itself? It is running inside an iframe, so we are not able to style it from the outside. We would need some way to add css styles that are applied within the iframe.
I wasnt able to clone a global header earlier.  Anyone know why that is or what I may have been forgetting to do?
Unless you have access to the server of the iframe content you won’t be able to style it.
nope, it's from HubSpot... I was hoping that there was some way around it
but thank you so much for answering!! :slightly_smiling_face: I appreciate it
HS staff who implemented the ability for admins to enable the new header menu just for themselves. thank you. appreciate it
<@U26DA9CQ0> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U26DA9CQ0/FBL3JCCG3/b56964a725560b12d10ffc5272971145.gif|b56964a725560b12d10ffc5272971145.gif>
A file, which can't be shown because your team is past the free storage limit, was commented on.
areeva durchy
Hey Jon, I noticed on the dark theme that in modules the accordion tabs on the right by default are hard to read. JUST an FYI..
Also if anyone has insight into what languages the majority of HS devs use that would be useful to get info on.
Irish** jk
Scottish English.
Also the recent edited files… Great job though

Yea I’ve noticed, been working on some fixes to several things with the dark theme.

If you’d like to help <https://github.com/williamspiro/HubSpot-Developer-Extension/tree/dm2-darktheme-tweaks>

It’s just the hsDarkIde.css file doing all the work for the theme.
Sweet. Ill see what I can do. This will be my first public Repo that I commit to if I do… :slightly_smiling_face: Yeah! for opensource
BTW you should probably do Japanese.. there are a lot of Japanese devs in the HubSpot world.
Good to know, that I’m definitely not going to be able to confirm whether the translations are useful at all
<insert HubSpot internal breakdown of developer accounts>
when I roll out multi-lingual I should definitely throw in a button for “help with our translations”
frankly I would love that

Thanks, Marco.  We have a few different stylesheets that are injected automatically (public_common, layout.min), as well as "HubSpot style boilerplate" and the form-builder styles which are injected into the DOM after page load.  It seems that perhaps the underlying DOM changes for forms as well.  I don't have anything specific at this point, but I'll try to make a note the next time the code changes.  

With so many dynamic styles coming in from outside our control, it would be nice if we could set a version and not be surprised.
Oh Yeah..
Drop in some google analytics
<https://www.change.org/p/boulter-release-HubSpot-developer-language-breakdown>
Yes, I just did this … it’s amazing how fast this stuff can be created
yea I plan to, it has to work a little differently than normally in an extension for obvious security reasons, so I haven’t spent the time to add it yet.
google does give me a country breakdown of users but it’s not super useful (how the data is provided)

Is there a HUBL equivalent to the get all blogs API endpoint?  <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/blogv2/get_blogs>

Or is there a HUBL way to get results from an API endpoint?
roflmao nice
gonna delete it soon - just thought it would make a good quick gag for <@U22PJPGK0>
lol
I don’t think so - What i’ve done previously was to store a list of blog IDs on a variable, then just nest a blog_recent_posts() loop within the loop for all blogs
Ok, thanks.  Yeah, I'm contemplating using HubDB to keep a list of blogs, but that seems kludgy.
It needs to be client editable.
BTW.. the text is good. I had a read and My wife (native Colombian) read it and said it sounds good.

lol Gonzalo pointed out that the translation for Cache buster was a little provacative when translated.

Appreciate the additional eyes on it
Yep No problem
ha. How would we even know that?
oh come now, you don’t have google analytics installed  there or, your own  tracking script?
I’m wondering if you can use the blog select in a custom module and loop through the “options” rather than the selected result

<https://spin.d.pr/VSVZ9Y+> this is coming from somewhere, and if it’s coming from somewhere, that means it’s stored somewhere, if it’s stored somewhere that means it’s quantifiable

(pulled from DOM of old design manager)
:stuck_out_tongue:
then you don’t need to keep a list as the HS system would be returning it in that blog select field
¯\_(ツ)_/¯ just a thought, may not even be possible

How about this <@U22PJPGK0>, can you get the number of people with each language setting who have the marketing tag? 

<https://spin.d.pr/foT9OR+>

I realize that we’re going to have some overlap of just normal marketers but that’s probably easier than finding the number of people with the permission for the design manager - even slightly skewed data is better than nothing.

would still appreciate the stats if possible, but think I figured out the hot languages to accomodate through this: 
<https://spin.d.pr/17PIRX+>
Yeah, I would go with that list. Frankly, I think it’s hard to write code all day and not know some english since all major programming languages are in english
but if you don’t speak any of those 5 languages, you’re going to have a hard time using our tools.

I agree, there’s just a few perks to doing multi-lingual — obviously people who speak another language would benefit, but the extension also gets better visibility in the chrome store apparently for having it. It seems relatively easy to add to our extension so I figure “why not”
<@U7SL518D6> is very good Spanish, completely correct
¿even the cache buster bit?
"Probador" sounds a bit odd may be Tester would be more common even is a spanglisation
Probador is where you try your clothes in a Store
hahaha
And Tema "oscuro" we would say Tema Dark directly
and "Más funciones por venir" it's a bit forced structure very literaly translated
You could say "Pronto más funciiones"
thats all to be detailed the rest perfect
Awesome! thank you Jordi I really appreciate it!
I'm only sad I'm not developer to help more, you are doing a great community job with this
It’s all good, you did something I couldn’t! I and the other developers can handle the computer languages, but human languages is a whole other thing
So happy to contribute :slightly_smiling_face:

Actually I have one more piece of text that would be awesome if you could tell me if the translation is okay

Footer jQuery : `Pie de página jQuery`

My guess is that the spanish translates like “bottom of the page jQuery” there might be a better way to write that.

German speaking devs out there I could use your help verifying some translations! <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/Content-Design-Questions/Need-German-Help-for-HubSpot-Developer-Chrome-Extension/m-p/196522#M6749>

These are for the Developer Chrome Extension.

Thank you guys!

Thanks for the tips.  The client wants to have a dropdown to select among multiple blogs.  I think I'm going to just have a HubDB table where they can enter a BlogID if they want it to appear in that dropdown.
